name: 12 Ridges Vineyard
descr: 12 Ridges Vineyard is a family-owned, cool climate vineyard located directly on the stunning Blue Ridge Parkway at mile post 25.  At an elevation of 3,300 feet, ​12 Ridges is one of, if not the, highest altitude vineyard in Virginia and its permeable and stony soil low in clay, cooler temperatures, and low humidity offer an extraordinary opportunity for local wine grower, Tim Jordan, to experiment and ply his craft.  The terroir of 12 Ridges has the potential to allow for exceptional traditional method sparkling wines, which will be complemented by offerings of Chardonnay, Riesling, Pinot Gris, and Pinot Noir.  As we wait for our vines to mature and grow, we are offering a portfolio of cool climate wines from around the world. Come visit our Tasting Room and 360 degree hill top to experience panoramic views and exceptional cool climate wines!

descr:
Caret Cellars is a family-owned and operated vineyard and winery by R.D. and Junghee Thompson. Located just off Route 17 in Essex County, Virginia, Caret Cellars is an hour northeast of Richmond, 40 miles southeast of Fredericksburg and 70 miles north of the Tidewater area.

Since planting the vineyard in 2007, both have been devoted to growing only the healthiest grapes which are key to producing great wine.

name: Chisholm Vineyards at Adventure Farm
descr:
Chisholm Vineyards has reopened! 
Expect Social Distancing and Cleanliness/Safety guidelines will be strictly followed.
Customers are required to wear masks when entering the site and moving around the site. Masks can be removed at your designated table area.
Outdoor seating only.
No reservations necessary for groups less than 10 persons.
All seating groups will be a minimum of 8 feet apart.
Lawn area seating available. Bring chairs and blankets if you like.
Children and dogs are welcome but must remain with their adult group at their designated table area.
No playing in the open spaces will be allowed for children or adults.
No dancing on the Pavilion dance floor.
Bottle sales only.
We will be using paper cups. You are welcome to purchase a glass to take home with you or bring your own glass.
Customers (not staff) will be pouring from purchased bottles.
The tasting bar and register will be off limits to customers.
Table service will be provided as well as contactless charges (no cash).
Bottled water will be available for purchase or bring your own. No cups of water will be given out.
Pre-packaged food will be for sale. You are also welcome you to bring a picnic. We will post online if a food truck will be on site. 
We request that no customers visit if they have a temperature, have symptoms of COVID-19 or have come in contact in the past 2 weeks with someone who has.
Staff will be wearing masks at all times and gloves during cleaning procedures. 
Staff will have their temperature taken before every shift and go through a health screening.
Table and chairs will be disinfected after each group leaves.
All common touch areas, such as our bar, door knobs and handles, will be cleaned hourly.
Bathrooms will be available for use while adhering to proper distancing protocol. They will be sanitized on an hourly basis.
Self-clearing of tables by customers will be encouraged. Multiple trash bins will be available on site.
Multiple sanitizing stations located on grounds. 
We will be proactively enforcing the above protocol to make sure all of our guests are safe. 
If you have any questions, don’t hesitate to ask. Contact us at info@chisholmvineyards.com or call/text 833-340-0086.
Curbside pickups 7 days a week by appointment during non-business hours. Orders can be placed by texting 833-340-0086.
Shipping to 38 states. Order online.

name: Dry Mill Vineyards & Winery
descr: Dry Mill Vineyards & Winery is snuggled into nine rolling acres just one mile outside historic Leesburg in a stable and barn that was once home to the horses and dogs of the Loudoun Hunt Club. Owners Dean and Nancy Vanhuss, with their daughter Michelle Pizzarello, have carefully restored it, using nearly all of the original wood to keep the spirit of the stable intact and give the winery a distinct rustic feel. Exposed wood beams, a tin roof, sconces, and a fireplace give the winery an updated and warm feeling. The original large wooden storm shutters now slide past the winery's French doors, and the loft has two balconies overlooking the attractive grounds. The patio seats up to 30 people for wine tasting and light fare.  For Dean Vanhuss, winemaking is a retirement venture after a career in technology. He has been growing grapes in Loudoun since the late 1990s and currently has six acres planted, most at Short Hill Vineyards, their home in Lovettsville.

name: Keswick Vineyards
descr:
Keswick Vineyards, established in 2000 by Al & Cindy Schornberg, is a family owned and operated winery specializing in small lots of high-quality wines that showcase the terroir of the Estate. Originally from Michigan, the Schornbergs chose Virginia to pursue their dream of owning a vineyard after an extensive search that spanned coast to coast.  Al recalls his grandfather’s stories of working at his uncle’s winery, Massena Cellars in France, and like his predecessor, his goal was straightforward: “I just wanted to be able to enjoy a really good wine that I made. There’s something very natural and satisfying about that.”  With their first vintage in 2002 winning the honor of "Best White Wine in America" at the Atlanta International Wine Summit, the Schornbergs knew they had made the right decision and set out to prove Virginia could also produce award-winning reds.  In 2009 they were awarded the Virginia Governor's Cup for their 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon, further transforming their dream into a reality.  Now, in 2016 Keswick Vineyards received their second Virginia Governor's Cup for their 2014 Cabernet Franc Reserve.  The Schornbergs are humbled and excited that their vision has evolved into a world-class vineyard and winery, with each year's vintage better than the last.  
Visit us and taste our wines that are "Born from the Soil and Soul of Virginia"!

name: Reynard Florence Vineyard
descr: There have been a lot of newcomers to Virginia wine over the last few decades and while Reynard Florence is only a few years old, founders and proprietors  Roe and Dee Allison are no strangers to the rolling hills of the Blue Ridge. The two, purchased the land where Reynard Florence is located shortly after they were married in 1976. Roe and Dee built their house in 1980 which overlooks the vineyard today. The couple raised their two sons, who also attended local schools, in that home. Instilled with a firm belief in maximizing the land's potential, Roe and Dee began planning a vineyard on the land where they had built their lives. Breaking ground in April '06 with only one half acre Petit Manseng vines, Reynard Florence has since expanded to include over 2 acres of Grenache, Petit Verdot, and Merlot. Under the direction of veteran vineyard consultant Chris Hill and winemaker Michael Shaps, Reynard Florence’s premier vintage in 2009 of Petit Manseng reflected not only the Allison’s love for the region, but also the care that went into the vineyard’s design and vine maintenance.

name: Sans Soucy Vineyards
descr:
We are a small family owned and operated farm winery located in the historic tobacco country in Brookneal Virginia, the 1st farm winery in Campbell county, just minutes away from Red Hill Patrick Henrys last home and resting place and within a 30 minute drive from historic Appomattox and the cities of Lynchburg and South Boston. The winery and tasting room are located in a century old restored barn and school house with all the original wood work. We grow a variety of vinifra and hybrid vines on 7 acres and we have an additional acre planted with heirloom apple trees. Our first planting was in 2000 with our first crush in 2006. 
In 2016 we also became a brewery, Staunton River Brewing Co, stop by and enjoy some wine , beer and Sangria! Food Truck every  Friday 1-8 and  Saturday's 1-8 
Self contained RV's and tent campers are welcome to overnight.

name: Saudé Creek Vineyards
descr: Situated high on a hillside adjacent to the Pamunkey River, breathtaking views and a rich history welcome you to Saude Creek Vineyards. The rolling landscape of the vineyard is accentuated by the grandeur of the tasting room. Frank's Tavern, a colonial inn and publick house, was once located on our winery site. Frank's was a favorite stop for wayfarers riding between points north or west and the Colonial capitol of Williamsburg. George Washington and the French General Rochambeau, among other patriots and notables of the time, reputedly slaked their thirst here. Boasting two decks, two patios, an event pavilion, and an outdoor stage, Saude Creek is a favorite for both locals and travelers alike with live music and fantastic food vendors each weekend. We at Saude Creek, invite you to sit back and relax with our beautiful views and award-winning wines.
